root_causes: Validation enforces HidScn4Bn4COrder_1 == 1 and HidScn4Bn4COrder_2 == 2 only, which fails when the randomized order is reversed (2 then 1).
No explicit check that each subquestion value is within the allowed range {1,2} using a range/any test, and no uniqueness check to ensure the two subquestions are assigned different positions.
instructions: Do not require specific codes per subquestion. Instead validate that both HidScn4Bn4COrder_1 and HidScn4Bn4COrder_2 are present and hold allowed values 1 or 2, and that they are not identical (ensure uniqueness).

Example logic to implement: sel if qTesting = 1 & ( miss(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1) or miss(HidScn4Bn4COrder_2) or ~range(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1,1,2) or ~range(HidScn4Bn4COrder_2,1,2) or HidScn4Bn4COrder_1 = HidScn4Bn4COrder_2 ). This flags missing, out-of-range, or duplicate position assignments.
Alternatively, explicitly allow the two valid permutations: flag if not ( (HidScn4Bn4COrder_1 = 1 & HidScn4Bn4COrder_2 = 2) or (HidScn4Bn4COrder_1 = 2 & HidScn4Bn4COrder_2 = 1) ).

root_causes: Validation enforces HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1 == 1 and HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2 == 2 only, which will fail when the randomized order is reversed (2 then 1).
Missing explicit range checks (allowing only values 1 or 2) and missing uniqueness check to ensure the two subquestions are assigned different positions.
instructions: Allow either ordering. Validate that both HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1 and HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2 are non-missing, within the allowed set {1,2}, and not equal to each other.

Example logic to implement: sel if qTesting = 1 & ( miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1) or miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1,1,2) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2,1,2) or HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1 = HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2 ).
Or explicitly permit the two valid permutations: flag if not ( (HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1 = 1 & HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2 = 2) or (HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1 = 2 & HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2 = 1) ).
